Fennix  1.0.0
Opeating System from scratch made in C and C++

15  while (fgets(line, 128, file)) {
16  char *pos;
17  if (!strchr(line, '\n') && !feof(file)) {
18  // skip truncated lines
19  for (int c = getc(file); c != '\n' && c != EOF; c = getc(file));
20  continue;
21  }
22 
23  // TODO(geert): resolv.conf can actually have multiple nameservers
24  // but we just pick the first one for now
25  if (!strncmp(line, "nameserver", 10) && isspace(line[10])) {
26  char *end;
27  for (pos = line + 11; isspace(*pos); pos++);
28  for (end = pos; *end && !isspace(*end); end++);
29  *end = '\0';
30  ret.name = frg::string<MemoryAllocator>(
31  pos, end - pos, getAllocator());
32  break;
33  }
34  }
35 
36  fclose(file);
37  if(ret.name.empty())
38  return frg::null_opt;
39  return ret;
40 }
fclose
int fclose(FILE *fp)
Definition: file.c:44
EOF
#define EOF
EOF - End of file.
Definition: stdio.h:17

Definition: file.c:11

10  {
11  if(entropy != nullptr) {
12  memcpy(&__stack_chk_guard, entropy, sizeof(__stack_chk_guard));
13  } else {
14  // If no entropy is available, set it to the terminator canary

440  }
441  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_GETPLANERESOURCES: {
442  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_get_plane_res *>(arg);
443 
444  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
445  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
446  req.set_command(request);
447 
448  frg::string<MemoryAllocator> ser(getSysdepsAllocator());
449  req.SerializeToString(&ser);
450 
451  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
452  handle,
453  helix_ng::offer(
454  helix_ng::sendBuffer(ser.data(), ser.size()),
455  helix_ng::recvInline())
456  );
457  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
458  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
459  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
460 
461  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
462  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
463  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
464 
465  // FIXME: send this via a helix_ng buffer
466  for(size_t i = 0; i < resp.drm_plane_res_size(); i++) {
467  if(i >= param->count_planes) {
468  continue;
469  }
470  auto dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->plane_id_ptr);
471  dest[i] = resp.drm_plane_res(i);
472  }
473 
474  param->count_planes = resp.drm_plane_res_size();
475 
476  *result = resp.result();
477 
478  return 0;
479  }
480  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_GETENCODER: {
481  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_get_encoder*>(arg);
482 
483  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
484  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
485  req.set_command(request);
486  req.set_drm_encoder_id(param->encoder_id);
487 
488  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
489  handle,
490  helix_ng::offer(
491  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
492  helix_ng::recvInline())
493  );
494  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
495  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
496  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
497 
498  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
499  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
500  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
501 
502  param->encoder_type = resp.drm_encoder_type();
503  param->crtc_id = resp.drm_crtc_id();
504  param->possible_crtcs = resp.drm_possible_crtcs();
505  param->possible_clones = resp.drm_possible_clones();
506 
507  *result = resp.result();
508  return 0;
509  }
510  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CREATE_DUMB: {
511  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_create_dumb*>(arg);
512 
513  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
514  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
515  req.set_command(request);
516 
517  req.set_drm_width(param->width);
518  req.set_drm_height(param->height);
519  req.set_drm_bpp(param->bpp);
520  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
521 
522  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
523  handle,
524  helix_ng::offer(
525  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
526  helix_ng::recvInline())
527  );
528  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
529  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
530  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
531 
532  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
533  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
534  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
535 
536  param->handle = resp.drm_handle();
537  param->pitch = resp.drm_pitch();
538  param->size = resp.drm_size();
539 
540  *result = resp.result();
541  return 0;
542  }
543  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_ADDFB: {
544  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_fb_cmd *>(arg);
545 
546  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
547  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
548  req.set_command(request);
549 
550  req.set_drm_width(param->width);
551  req.set_drm_height(param->height);
552  req.set_drm_pitch(param->pitch);
553  req.set_drm_bpp(param->bpp);
554  req.set_drm_depth(param->depth);
555  req.set_drm_handle(param->handle);
556 
557  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
558  handle,
559  helix_ng::offer(
560  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
561  helix_ng::recvInline())
562  );
563  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
564  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
565  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
566 
567  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
568  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
569  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
570 
571  param->fb_id = resp.drm_fb_id();
572 
573  *result = resp.result();
574  return 0;
575  }
576  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_ADDFB2: {
577  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_fb_cmd2 *>(arg);
578 
579  if(param->pixel_format != DRM_FORMAT_XRGB8888)
580  mlibc::infoLogger() << "mlibc: Unexpected pixel format "
581  << frg::hex_fmt(param->pixel_format) << frg::endlog;
582  __ensure(param->pixel_format == DRM_FORMAT_XRGB8888
583  || param->pixel_format == DRM_FORMAT_ARGB8888);
584  __ensure(!param->flags || param->flags == DRM_MODE_FB_MODIFIERS);
585  __ensure(!param->modifier[0] || param->modifier[0] == DRM_FORMAT_MOD_INVALID);
586  __ensure(!param->offsets[0]);
587 
588  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
589  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
590  req.set_command(DRM_IOCTL_MODE_ADDFB);
591 
592  req.set_drm_width(param->width);
593  req.set_drm_height(param->height);
594  req.set_drm_pitch(param->pitches[0]);
595  req.set_drm_bpp(32);
596  req.set_drm_depth(24);
597  req.set_drm_handle(param->handles[0]);
598 
599  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
600  handle,
601  helix_ng::offer(
602  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
603  helix_ng::recvInline())
604  );
605  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
606  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
607  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
608 
609  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
610  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
611  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
612 
613  param->fb_id = resp.drm_fb_id();
614 
615  *result = resp.result();
616  return 0;
617  }
618  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_RMFB: {
619  auto param = reinterpret_cast<int *>(arg);
620 
621  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
622  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
623  req.set_command(request);
624 
625  req.set_drm_fb_id(*param);
626 
627  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
628  handle,
629  helix_ng::offer(
630  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
631  helix_ng::recvInline())
632  );
633  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
634  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
635  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
636 
637  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
638  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
639  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
640 
641  *result = resp.result();
642  return 0;
643  }
644  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_MAP_DUMB: {
645  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_map_dumb*>(arg);
646 
647  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
648  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
649  req.set_command(request);
650 
651  req.set_drm_handle(param->handle);
652 
653  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
654  handle,
655  helix_ng::offer(
656  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
657  helix_ng::recvInline())
658  );
659  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
660  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
661  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
662 
663  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
664  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
665  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
666 
667  param->offset = resp.drm_offset();
668 
669  *result = resp.result();
670  return 0;
671  }
672  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_GETCRTC: {
673  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_crtc*>(arg);
674 
675  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
676  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
677  req.set_command(request);
678  req.set_drm_crtc_id(param->crtc_id);
679 
680  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp, recv_data] = exchangeMsgsSync(
681  handle,
682  helix_ng::offer(
683  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
684  helix_ng::recvInline(),
685  helix_ng::recvBuffer(&param->mode, sizeof(drm_mode_modeinfo)))
686  );
687 
688  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
689  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
690  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
691  HEL_CHECK(recv_data.error());
692 
693  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
694  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
695  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
696 
697  param->fb_id = resp.drm_fb_id();
698  param->x = resp.drm_x();
699  param->y = resp.drm_y();
700  param->gamma_size = resp.drm_gamma_size();
701  param->mode_valid = resp.drm_mode_valid();
702 
703  *result = resp.result();
704  return 0;
705  }
706  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_SETCRTC: {
707  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_crtc*>(arg);
708 
709  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
710  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
711  req.set_command(request);
712 
713  for(size_t i = 0; i < param->count_connectors; i++) {
714  auto dest = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->set_connectors_ptr);
715  req.add_drm_connector_ids(dest[i]);
716  }
717  req.set_drm_x(param->x);
718  req.set_drm_y(param->y);
719  req.set_drm_crtc_id(param->crtc_id);
720  req.set_drm_fb_id(param->fb_id);
721  req.set_drm_mode_valid(param->mode_valid);
722 
723  auto [offer, send_req, send_mode, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
724  handle,
725  helix_ng::offer(
726  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
727  helix_ng::sendBuffer(&param->mode, sizeof(drm_mode_modeinfo)),
728  helix_ng::recvInline())
729  );
730 
731  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
732  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
733  HEL_CHECK(send_mode.error());
734  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
735 
736  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
737  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
738  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
739 
740  *result = resp.result();
741  return 0;
742  }
743  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_OBJ_GETPROPERTIES: {
744  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_obj_get_properties *>(arg);
745 
746  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
747  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
748  req.set_command(request);
749 
750  req.set_drm_count_props(param->count_props);
751  req.set_drm_obj_id(param->obj_id);
752  req.set_drm_obj_type(param->obj_type);
753 
754  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
755  handle,
756  helix_ng::offer(
757  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
758  helix_ng::recvInline())
759  );
760  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
761  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
762  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
763 
764  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
765  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
766  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
767 
768  auto props = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->props_ptr);
769  auto prop_vals = reinterpret_cast<uint64_t *>(param->prop_values_ptr);
770 
771  for(size_t i = 0; i < resp.drm_obj_property_ids_size(); i++) {
772  if(i >= param->count_props) {
773  break;
774  }
775  props[i] = resp.drm_obj_property_ids(i);
776  prop_vals[i] = resp.drm_obj_property_values(i);
777  }
778 
779  param->count_props = resp.drm_obj_property_ids_size();
780 
781  *result = resp.result();
782  return 0;
783  }
784  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_PAGE_FLIP: {
785  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_crtc_page_flip *>(arg);
786 
787  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
788  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
789  req.set_command(request);
790 
791  __ensure(!(param->flags & ~DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT));
792  req.set_drm_crtc_id(param->crtc_id);
793  req.set_drm_fb_id(param->fb_id);
794  req.set_drm_cookie(param->user_data);
795 
796  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
797  handle,
798  helix_ng::offer(
799  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
800  helix_ng::recvInline())
801  );
802  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
803  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
804  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
805 
806  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
807  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
808  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
809 
810  *result = resp.result();
811  return 0;
812  }
813  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_DIRTYFB: {
814  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_fb_dirty_cmd*>(arg);
815 
816  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
817  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
818  req.set_command(request);
819 
820  req.set_drm_fb_id(param->fb_id);
821  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
822  req.set_drm_color(param->color);
823  for(size_t i = 0; i < param->num_clips; i++) {
824  auto dest = reinterpret_cast<drm_clip_rect *>(param->clips_ptr);
825  managarm::fs::Rect<MemoryAllocator> clip(getSysdepsAllocator());
826  clip.set_x1(dest->x1);
827  clip.set_y1(dest->y1);
828  clip.set_x2(dest->x2);
829  clip.set_y2(dest->y2);
830  req.add_drm_clips(std::move(clip));
831  }
832 
833  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
834  handle,
835  helix_ng::offer(
836  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
837  helix_ng::recvInline())
838  );
839  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
840  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
841  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
842 
843  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
844  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
845 
846  if(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT) {
847  return EINVAL;
848  }else{
849  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
850  *result = resp.result();
851  return 0;
852  }
853  }
854  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CURSOR: {
855  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_cursor *>(arg);
856 
857  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
858  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
859  req.set_command(request);
860 
861  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
862  req.set_drm_crtc_id(param->crtc_id);
863 
864  if (param->flags == DRM_MODE_CURSOR_MOVE) {
865  req.set_drm_x(param->x);
866  req.set_drm_y(param->y);
867  } else if (param->flags == DRM_MODE_CURSOR_BO) {
868  req.set_drm_width(param->width);
869  req.set_drm_height(param->height);
870  req.set_drm_handle(param->handle);
871  } else {
872  mlibc::infoLogger() << "\e[35mmlibc: invalid flags in DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CURSOR\e[39m" << frg::endlog;
873  return EINVAL;
874  }
875 
876  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
877  handle,
878  helix_ng::offer(
879  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
880  helix_ng::recvInline())
881  );
882  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
883  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
884  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
885 
886  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
887  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
888 
889  if (resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::NO_BACKING_DEVICE) {
890  return ENXIO;
891  }else if (resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT) {
892  return EINVAL;
893  }else{
894  *result = resp.result();
895  return 0;
896  }
897  }
898  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_DESTROY_DUMB: {
899  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_destroy_dumb *>(arg);
900 
901  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
902  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
903  req.set_command(request);
904 
905  req.set_drm_handle(param->handle);
906 
907  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
908  handle,
909  helix_ng::offer(
910  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
911  helix_ng::recvInline())
912  );
913  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
914  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
915  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
916 
917  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
918  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
919 
920  *result = resp.result();
921  return 0;
922  }
923  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CREATEPROPBLOB: {
924  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_create_blob *>(arg);
925 
926  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
927  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
928  req.set_command(request);
929  req.set_drm_blob_size(param->length);
930 
931  auto [offer, send_req, blob_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
932  handle,
933  helix_ng::offer(
934  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
935  helix_ng::sendBuffer(reinterpret_cast<void *>(param->data), param->length),
936  helix_ng::recvInline())
937  );
938  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
939  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
940  HEL_CHECK(blob_req.error());
941  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
942 
943  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
944  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
945  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
946 
947  param->blob_id = resp.drm_blob_id();
948 
949  *result = resp.result();
950  return 0;
951  }
952  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_DESTROYPROPBLOB: {
953  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_destroy_blob *>(arg);
954 
955  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
956  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
957  req.set_command(request);
958  req.set_drm_blob_id(param->blob_id);
959 
960  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
961  handle,
962  helix_ng::offer(
963  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
964  helix_ng::recvInline())
965  );
966  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
967  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
968  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
969 
970  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
971  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
972  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
973 
974  *result = resp.result();
975  return 0;
976  }
977  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_ATOMIC: {
978  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_atomic *>(arg);
979 
980  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
981  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
982  req.set_command(request);
983  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
984  req.set_drm_cookie(param->user_data);
985 
986  size_t prop_count = 0;
987  auto objs_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->objs_ptr);
988  auto count_props_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->count_props_ptr);
989  auto props_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint32_t *>(param->props_ptr);
990  auto prop_values_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint64_t *>(param->prop_values_ptr);
991 
992  for(size_t i = 0; i < param->count_objs; i++) {
993  /* list of modeobjs and their property count */
994  req.add_drm_obj_ids(objs_ptr[i]);
995  req.add_drm_prop_counts(count_props_ptr[i]);
996  prop_count += count_props_ptr[i];
997  }
998 
999  for(size_t i = 0; i < prop_count; i++) {
1000  /* array of property IDs */
1001  req.add_drm_props(props_ptr[i]);
1002  /* array of property values */
1003  req.add_drm_prop_values(prop_values_ptr[i]);
1004  }
1005 
1006  auto [offer, send_req, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
1007  handle,
1008  helix_ng::offer(
1009  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
1010  helix_ng::recvInline())
1011  );
1012  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
1013  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
1014  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
1015 
1016  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
1017  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
1018 
1019  *result = resp.result();
1020  return 0;
1021  }
1022  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_LIST_LESSEES: {
1023  mlibc::infoLogger() << "\e[35mmlibc: DRM_IOCTL_MODE_LIST_LESSEES"
1024  " is not implemented correctly\e[39m" << frg::endlog;
1025  return EINVAL;
1026  }
1027  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_SETGAMMA: {
1028  mlibc::infoLogger() << "\e[35mmlibc: DRM_IOCTL_MODE_SETGAMMA"
1029  " is not implemented correctly\e[39m" << frg::endlog;
1030  return 0;
1031  }
1032  case DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CREATE_LEASE: {
1033  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_mode_create_lease *>(arg);
1034 
1035  mlibc::infoLogger() << "\e[35mmlibc: DRM_IOCTL_MODE_CREATE_LEASE"
1036  " is a noop\e[39m" << frg::endlog;
1037  param->lessee_id = 1;
1038  param->fd = fd;
1039  *result = 0;
1040  return 0;
1041  }
1042  case DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE: {
1043  mlibc::infoLogger() << "\e[35mmlibc: DRM_IOCTL_GEM_CLOSE"
1044  " is a noop\e[39m" << frg::endlog;
1045  return 0;
1046  }
1047  case DRM_IOCTL_PRIME_HANDLE_TO_FD: {
1048  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_prime_handle *>(arg);
1049 
1050  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
1051  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
1052  req.set_command(request);
1053  req.set_drm_prime_handle(param->handle);
1054  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
1055 
1056  auto [offer, send_req, send_creds, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
1057  handle,
1058  helix_ng::offer(
1059  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
1060  helix_ng::imbueCredentials(),
1061  helix_ng::recvInline())
1062  );
1063  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
1064  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
1065  HEL_CHECK(send_creds.error());
1066  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
1067 
1068  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
1069  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
1070  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
1071 
1072  param->fd = resp.drm_prime_fd();
1073  *result = resp.result();
1074  return 0;
1075  }
1076  case DRM_IOCTL_PRIME_FD_TO_HANDLE: {
1077  auto param = reinterpret_cast<drm_prime_handle *>(arg);
1078 
1079  managarm::fs::CntRequest<MemoryAllocator> req(getSysdepsAllocator());
1080  req.set_req_type(managarm::fs::CntReqType::PT_IOCTL);
1081  req.set_command(request);
1082  req.set_drm_flags(param->flags);
1083 
1084  auto [offer, send_req, send_creds, recv_resp] = exchangeMsgsSync(
1085  handle,
1086  helix_ng::offer(
1087  helix_ng::sendBragiHeadOnly(req, getSysdepsAllocator()),
1088  helix_ng::imbueCredentials(getHandleForFd(param->fd)),
1089  helix_ng::recvInline())
1090  );
1091  HEL_CHECK(offer.error());
1092  HEL_CHECK(send_req.error());
1093  HEL_CHECK(send_creds.error());
1094  HEL_CHECK(recv_resp.error());
1095 
1096  managarm::fs::SvrResponse<MemoryAllocator> resp(getSysdepsAllocator());
1097  resp.ParseFromArray(recv_resp.data(), recv_resp.length());
1098  if(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::FILE_NOT_FOUND) {
1099  return EBADF;
1100  } else {
1101  __ensure(resp.error() == managarm::fs::Errors::SUCCESS);
1102  }
1103 
1104  param->handle = resp.drm_prime_handle();
1105  *result = resp.result();
1106  return 0;
1107  }
1108  }
1109 
1110  mlibc::infoLogger() << "mlibc: Unexpected DRM ioctl with"
1111  << ", number: 0x" << frg::hex_fmt(_IOC_NR(request))
1112  << " (raw request: " << frg::hex_fmt(request) << ")" << frg::endlog;
1113  __ensure(!"Illegal ioctl request");
1114  __builtin_unreachable();
1115 }

int mlibc::lookup_addr_dns ( frg::span< char >  name,
frg::array< uint8_t, 16 > &  addr,

)

Definition at line 163 of file lookup.cpp.

163  {
164  frg::string<MemoryAllocator> request{getAllocator()};
165 
166  int num_q = 1;
167  struct dns_header header;
168  header.identification = htons(123);
169  header.flags = htons(0x100);
170  header.no_q = htons(num_q);
171  header.no_ans = htons(0);
172  header.no_auths = htons(0);
173  header.no_additional = htons(0);
174 
175  request.resize(sizeof(header));
176  memcpy(request.data(), &header, sizeof(header));
177 
178  char addr_str[64];
179  if(!inet_ntop(family, addr.data(), addr_str, sizeof(addr_str))) {
180  switch(errno) {
181  case EAFNOSUPPORT:
182  return -EAI_FAMILY;
183  case ENOSPC:
184  return -EAI_OVERFLOW;
185  default:
186  return -EAI_FAIL;
187  }
188  }
189  frg::string<MemoryAllocator> req_str{getAllocator(), addr_str};
190  req_str += ".in-addr.arpa";
191 
192  frg::string_view req_view{req_str.data(), req_str.size()};
193  size_t ptr = 0;
194  do {
195  size_t next = req_view.find_first('.', ptr);
196  size_t length = next != (size_t)-1 ? next - ptr : req_view.size() - ptr;
197  frg::string_view substring = req_view.sub_string(ptr, length);
198  request += char(length);
199  request += substring;
200  ptr = next + 1;
201  } while(ptr != 0);
202 
203  request += char(0);
204  // set question type to fetch PTR records
205  request += 0;
206  request += 12;
207  // set CLASS to IN
208  request += 0;
209  request += 1;
210 
211 
212  struct sockaddr_in sin = {};
213  sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
214  // TODO(geert): we could probably make this use the service lookup
215  // for dns
216  sin.sin_port = htons(53);
217 
218  auto nameserver = get_nameserver();
219  if (!inet_aton(nameserver ? nameserver->name.data() : "127.0.0.1", &sin.sin_addr)) {
220  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): inet_aton() failed!" << frg::endlog;
221  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
222  }
223 
224  int fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
225  if (fd < 0) {
226  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): socket() failed" << frg::endlog;
227  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
228  }
229 
230  size_t sent = sendto(fd, request.data(), request.size(), 0,
231  (struct sockaddr*)&sin, sizeof(sin));
232  if (sent != request.size()) {
233  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): sendto() failed to send everything" << frg::endlog;
234  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
235  }
236 
237  char response[256];
238  ssize_t rlen;
239  int num_ans = 0;
240  while ((rlen = recvfrom(fd, response, 256, 0, NULL, NULL)) >= 0) {
241  if ((size_t)rlen < sizeof(struct dns_header))
242  continue;
243  auto response_header = reinterpret_cast<struct dns_header*>(response);
244  if (response_header->identification != header.identification)
245  return -EAI_FAIL;
246 
247  auto it = response + sizeof(struct dns_header);
248  for (int i = 0; i < ntohs(response_header->no_q); i++) {
249  auto dns_name = read_dns_name(response, it);
250  (void) dns_name;
251  it += 4;
252  }
253 
254  for (int i = 0; i < ntohs(response_header->no_ans); i++) {
255  struct dns_addr_buf buffer;
256  auto dns_name = read_dns_name(response, it);
257 
258  uint16_t rr_type = (it[0] << 8) | it[1];
259  uint16_t rr_class = (it[2] << 8) | it[3];
260  uint16_t rr_length = (it[8] << 8) | it[9];
261  it += 10;
262  (void)rr_class;
263  (void)rr_length;
264 
265  (void)dns_name;
266 
267  switch (rr_type) {
268  case RECORD_PTR: {
269  auto ptr_name = read_dns_name(response, it);
270  if (ptr_name.size() >= name.size())
271  return -EAI_OVERFLOW;
272  std::copy(ptr_name.begin(), ptr_name.end(), name.data());
273  name.data()[ptr_name.size()] = '\0';
274  return 1;
275  }
276  default:
277  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_addr_dns: unknown rr type "
278  << rr_type << frg::endlog;
279  break;
280  }
281  num_ans += ntohs(response_header->no_ans);
282 
283  if (num_ans >= num_q)
284  break;
285  }
286  }
287 
288  close(fd);
289  return 0;
290 }

358  {
359  auto file = fopen("/etc/hosts", "r");
360  if (!file) {
361  switch (errno) {
362  case ENOENT:
363  case ENOTDIR:
364  case EACCES:
365  return -EAI_SERVICE;
366  default:
367  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
368  }
369  }
370 
371  // Buffer to hold ASCII version of address
372  char addr_str[64];
373  if(!inet_ntop(family, addr.data(), addr_str, sizeof(addr_str))) {
374  switch(errno) {
375  case EAFNOSUPPORT:
376  return -EAI_FAMILY;
377  case ENOSPC:
378  return -EAI_OVERFLOW;
379  default:
380  return -EAI_FAIL;
381  }
382  }
383  int addr_str_len = strlen(addr_str);
384 
385  char line[128];
386  while (fgets(line, 128, file)) {
387  char *pos;
388  // same way to deal with comments as in services.cpp
389  if ((pos = strchr(line, '#'))) {
390  *pos++ = '\n';
391  *pos = '\0';
392  }
393  if (strncmp(line, addr_str, addr_str_len))
394  continue;
395 
396  for (pos = line + addr_str_len + 1; isspace(*pos); pos++);
397  char *begin = pos;
398  for (; !isspace(*pos); pos++);
399  char *end = pos;
400 
401  size_t size = end - begin;
402  if (size >= name.size())
403  return -EAI_OVERFLOW;
404  std::copy(begin, end, name.data());
405  name.data()[size] = '\0';
406  return 1;
407  }
408  return 0;
409 }

Definition at line 49 of file lookup.cpp.

50  {
51  frg::string<MemoryAllocator> request{getAllocator()};
52 
53  int num_q = 1;
54  struct dns_header header;
55  header.identification = htons(123);
56  header.flags = htons(0x100);
57  header.no_q = htons(num_q);
58  header.no_ans = htons(0);
59  header.no_auths = htons(0);
60  header.no_additional = htons(0);
61 
62  request.resize(sizeof(header));
63  memcpy(request.data(), &header, sizeof(header));
64 
65  const char *end = name;
66  while (*end != '\0') {
67  end = strchrnul(name, '.');
68  size_t length = end - name;
69  frg::string_view substring{name, length};
70  name += length + 1;
71  request += char(length);
72  request += substring;
73  }
74 
75  request += char(0);
76  // set question type to fetch A records
77  request += 0;
78  request += 1;
79  // set CLASS to IN
80  request += 0;
81  request += 1;
82 
83  struct sockaddr_in sin = {};
84  sin.sin_family = AF_INET;
85  // TODO(geert): we could probably make this use the service lookup
86  // for dns
87  sin.sin_port = htons(53);
88 
89  auto nameserver = get_nameserver();
90  if (!inet_aton(nameserver ? nameserver->name.data() : "127.0.0.1", &sin.sin_addr)) {
91  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): inet_aton() failed!" << frg::endlog;
92  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
93  }
94 
95  int fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
96  if (fd < 0) {
97  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): socket() failed" << frg::endlog;
98  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
99  }
100 
101  size_t sent = sendto(fd, request.data(), request.size(), 0,
102  (struct sockaddr*)&sin, sizeof(sin));
103  if (sent != request.size()) {
104  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns(): sendto() failed to send everything" << frg::endlog;
105  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
106  }
107 
108  char response[256];
109  ssize_t rlen;
110  int num_ans = 0;
111  while ((rlen = recvfrom(fd, response, 256, 0, NULL, NULL)) >= 0) {
112  if ((size_t)rlen < sizeof(struct dns_header))
113  continue;
114  auto response_header = reinterpret_cast<struct dns_header*>(response);
115  if (response_header->identification != header.identification)
116  return -EAI_FAIL;
117 
118  auto it = response + sizeof(struct dns_header);
119  for (int i = 0; i < ntohs(response_header->no_q); i++) {
120  auto dns_name = read_dns_name(response, it);
121  (void) dns_name;
122  it += 4;
123  }
124 
125  for (int i = 0; i < ntohs(response_header->no_ans); i++) {
126  struct dns_addr_buf buffer;
127  auto dns_name = read_dns_name(response, it);
128 
129  uint16_t rr_type = (it[0] << 8) | it[1];
130  uint16_t rr_class = (it[2] << 8) | it[3];
131  uint16_t rr_length = (it[8] << 8) | it[9];
132  it += 10;
133  (void)rr_class;
134 
135  switch (rr_type) {
136  case RECORD_A:
137  memcpy(buffer.addr, it, rr_length);
138  it += rr_length;
139  buffer.family = AF_INET;
140  buffer.name = std::move(dns_name);
141  buf.buf.push(std::move(buffer));
142  break;
143  case RECORD_CNAME:
144  canon_name = std::move(read_dns_name(response, it));
145  buf.aliases.push(std::move(dns_name));
146  break;
147  default:
148  mlibc::infoLogger() << "lookup_name_dns: unknown rr type "
149  << rr_type << frg::endlog;
150  break;
151  }
152  }
153  num_ans += ntohs(response_header->no_ans);
154 
155  if (num_ans >= num_q)
156  break;
157  }
158 
159  close(fd);
160  return buf.buf.size();
161 }

◆ lookup_name_hosts()

int mlibc::lookup_name_hosts ( struct lookup_result &  buf,
const char *  name,
frg::string< MemoryAllocator > &  canon_name 
)

Definition at line 292 of file lookup.cpp.

293  {
294  auto file = fopen("/etc/hosts", "r");
295  if (!file) {
296  switch (errno) {
297  case ENOENT:
298  case ENOTDIR:
299  case EACCES:
300  return -EAI_SERVICE;
301  default:
302  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
303  }
304  }
305 
306  char line[128];
307  int name_length = strlen(name);
308  while (fgets(line, 128, file)) {
309  char *pos;
310  // same way to deal with comments as in services.cpp
311  if ((pos = strchr(line, '#'))) {
312  *pos++ = '\n';
313  *pos = '\0';
314  }
315 
316  for(pos = line + 1; (pos = strstr(pos, name)) &&
317  (!isspace(pos[-1]) || !isspace(pos[name_length])); pos++);
318  if (!pos)
319  continue;
320 
321  for (pos = line; !isspace(*pos); pos++);
322  *pos = '\0';
323 
324  // TODO(geert): we assume ipv4 for now
325  struct in_addr addr;
326  if (!inet_aton(line, &addr))
327  continue;
328 
329  pos++;
330  for(; *pos && isspace(*pos); pos++);
331  char *end;
332  for(end = pos; *end && !isspace(*end); end++);
333 
334  struct dns_addr_buf buffer;
335  memcpy(buffer.addr, &addr, 4);
336  buffer.family = AF_INET;
337  buffer.name = frg::string<MemoryAllocator>{pos,
338  static_cast<size_t>(end - pos), getAllocator()};
339  canon_name = buffer.name;
340 
341  buf.buf.push(std::move(buffer));
342 
343  pos = end;
344  while (pos[1]) {
345  for (; *pos && isspace(*pos); pos++);
346  for (end = pos; *end && !isspace(*end); end++);
347  auto name = frg::string<MemoryAllocator>{pos,
348  static_cast<size_t>(end - pos), getAllocator()};
349  buf.aliases.push(std::move(name));
350  pos = end;
351  }
352  }
353 
354  fclose(file);
355  return buf.buf.size();
356 }

456  in_addr_t addr = 0;

458 
459  if (res <= 0)
460  return -EAI_NONAME;

486  in_addr_t addr4 = 0;

488

490  struct dns_addr_buf addr_buf;
491  addr_buf.family = AF_INET;
492  memcpy(&addr_buf.addr, &addr4, 4);

160  {
161  switch(socktype) {
162  case SOCK_STREAM:
163  if (!proto)
164  proto = IPPROTO_TCP;
165  else if (proto != IPPROTO_TCP)
166  return -EAI_SERVICE;
167  break;
168  case SOCK_DGRAM:
169  if (!proto)
170  proto = IPPROTO_UDP;
171  else if (proto != IPPROTO_UDP)
172  return -EAI_SERVICE;
173  break;
174  case 0:
175  break;
176  default:
177  if (name)
178  return -EAI_SERVICE;
179  buf[0].port = 0;
180  buf[0].socktype = socktype;
181  buf[0].protocol = proto;
182  return 1;
183  }
184 
185  char *end = nullptr;
186  unsigned int port = 0;
187  int count = 0;
188 
189  if (name) {
190  if (!*name)
191  return -EAI_SERVICE;
192  port = strtoul(name, &end, 10);
193  }
194  // The end pointer is a null pointer so the name was a port
195  // or the name was not specified.
196  if (!end || !*end) {
197  if (proto != IPPROTO_UDP) {
198  buf[count].port = port;
199  buf[count].protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
200  buf[count].socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
201  count++;
202  }
203  if (proto != IPPROTO_TCP) {
204  buf[count].port = port;
205  buf[count].protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
206  buf[count].socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
207  count++;
208  }
209  return count;
210  }
211 
212  if (flags & AI_NUMERICSERV)
213  return -EAI_NONAME;
214 
215  return lookup_serv_file_name(buf, name, proto);
216 }

98  {
99  auto file = fopen(_PATH_SERVICES, "r");
100  if (!file) {
101  switch (errno) {
102  case ENOENT:
103  case ENOTDIR:
104  case EACCES:
105  return -EAI_SERVICE;
106  default:
107  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
108  }
109  }
110 
111  char line[128];
112  int name_length = strlen(name);
113  while(fgets(line, 128, file)) {
114  char *pos;
115  // easy way to handle comments, just move the end of the line
116  // to the beginning of the comment
117  if ((pos = strchr(line, '#'))) {
118  *pos++ = '\n';
119  *pos = '\0';
120  }
121 
122  for (pos = line; (pos = strstr(pos, name)); pos++) {
123  // the name must start and end with a space
124  if (pos > line && !isspace(pos[-1]))
125  continue;
126  if (pos[name_length] && !isspace(pos[name_length]))
127  continue;
128  break;
129  }
130  if (!pos)
131  continue;
132 
133  // Skip the name at the beginning of the line.
134  for(pos = line; *pos && !isspace(*pos); pos++)
135  ;
136 
137  char *end = NULL;
138  int port = strtoul(pos, &end, 10);
139  if (port > 65535 || end == pos)
140  continue;
141 
142  struct service_buf sbuf;
143  sbuf.port = port;
144  sbuf.name = frg::string<MemoryAllocator>(name, getAllocator());
145  if (!parse_rest(sbuf, end, proto))
146  continue;
147 
148  buf.push_back(sbuf);
149 
150  }
151 
152  fclose(file);
153  return buf.size();
154 }

◆ lookup_serv_file_port()

static int mlibc::lookup_serv_file_port ( service_result &  buf,
int  proto,
int  port 
)
static

Definition at line 34 of file services.cpp.

34  {
35  auto file = fopen(_PATH_SERVICES, "r");
36  if (!file) {
37  switch (errno) {
38  case ENOENT:
39  case ENOTDIR:
40  case EACCES:
41  return -EAI_SERVICE;
42  default:
43  return -EAI_SYSTEM;
44  }
45  }
46 
47  char line_buf[129] = {0};
48  char *line = line_buf + 1;
49  while(fgets(line, 128, file)) {
50  int name_length = 0;
51  char *pos;
52  // easy way to handle comments, just move the end of the line
53  // to the beginning of the comment
54  if ((pos = strchr(line, '#'))) {
55  *pos++ = '\n';
56  *pos = '\0';
57  }
58 
59  char *end = NULL;
60  for (pos = line; *pos; pos++) {
61  for (; isalpha(*pos); pos++);
62  int rport = strtoul(pos, &end, 10);
63  if (rport != port || rport > 65535) {
64  pos = end;
65  continue;
66  }
67 
68  // We have found the port, time to rewind to the start
69  // of the line.
70  for (; pos[-1]; pos--)
71  if(!isspace(pos[-1]))
72  name_length++;
73  break;
74  }
75 
76  if (!pos)
77  continue;
78 
79  if (!name_length)
80  continue;
81 
82  auto name = frg::string<MemoryAllocator>(pos, name_length,
83  getAllocator());
84 
85  struct service_buf sbuf = {};
86  sbuf.port = port;
87  sbuf.name = std::move(name);
88  if (!parse_rest(sbuf, end, proto))
89  continue;
90  buf.push_back(std::move(sbuf));
91  }
92 
93  fclose(file);
94  return buf.size();
95 }

◆ stringToInteger()

template<typename Return , typename Char >
Return mlibc::stringToInteger ( const Char *__restrict  nptr,
Char **__restrict  endptr,
int  baseInt 
)

Definition at line 60 of file strtol.hpp.

60  {
61  using UnsignedReturn = std::make_unsigned_t<Return>;
62 
63  auto base = static_cast<Return>(baseInt);
64  auto s = nptr;
65 
66  if (base < 0 || base == 1) {
67  if (endptr)
68  *endptr = const_cast<Char *>(nptr);
69  return 0;
70  }
71 
72  while (char_detail<Char>::isSpace(*s))
73  s++;
74 
75  bool negative = false;
76  if (*s == widen<Char>('-')) {
77  negative = true;
78  s++;
79  } else if (*s == widen<Char>('+')) {
80  s++;
81  }
82 
83 
84  bool hasOctalPrefix = s[0] == widen<Char>('0');
85  bool hasHexPrefix = hasOctalPrefix && (s[1] == widen<Char>('x') || s[1] == widen<Char>('X'));
86 
87  // There's two tricky cases we need to keep in mind here:
88  // 1. We should interpret "0x5" as hex 5 rather than octal 0.
89  // 2. We should interpret "0x" as octal 0 (and set endptr correctly).
90  // To deal with 2, we check the charcacter following the hex prefix.
91  if ((base == 0 || base == 16) && hasHexPrefix && char_detail<Char>::isHexDigit(s[2])) {
92  s += 2;
93  base = 16;
94  } else if ((base == 0 || base == 8) && hasOctalPrefix) {
95  base = 8;
96  } else if (base == 0) {
97  base = 10;
98  }
99 
100  // Compute the range of acceptable values.
101  UnsignedReturn cutoff, cutlim;
102  if (std::is_unsigned_v<Return>) {
103  cutoff = int_limits<Return>::max() / base;
104  cutlim = int_limits<Return>::max() % base;
105  } else {
106  Return co = negative ? int_limits<Return>::min() : int_limits<Return>::max();
107  cutlim = negative ? -(co % base) : co % base;
108  co /= negative ? -base : base;
109  cutoff = co;
110  }
111 
112  UnsignedReturn totalValue = 0;
113  bool convertedAny = false;
114  bool outOfRange = false;
115  for (Char c = *s; c != widen<Char>('\0'); c = *++s) {
116  UnsignedReturn digitValue;
117  if (char_detail<Char>::isDigit(c))
118  digitValue = c - widen<Char>('0');
119  else if (char_detail<Char>::isUpper(c))
120  digitValue = c - widen<Char>('A') + 10;
121  else if (char_detail<Char>::isLower(c))
122  digitValue = c - widen<Char>('a') + 10;
123  else
124  break;
125 
126  if (digitValue >= static_cast<UnsignedReturn>(base))
127  break;
128 
129  if (outOfRange) {
130  // The value is already known to be out of range, but we need to keep
131  // consuming characters until we can't (to set endptr correctly).
132  } else if (totalValue > cutoff || (totalValue == cutoff && digitValue > cutlim)) {
133  // The value will be out of range if we accumulate digitValue.
134  outOfRange = true;
135  } else {
136  totalValue = (totalValue * base) + digitValue;
137  convertedAny = true;
138  }
139  }
140 
141  if (endptr)
142  *endptr = const_cast<Char *>(convertedAny ? s : nptr);
143 
144  if (outOfRange) {
145  errno = ERANGE;
146 
147  if (std::is_unsigned_v<Return>) {
148  return int_limits<Return>::max();
149  } else {
150  return negative ? int_limits<Return>::min() : int_limits<Return>::max();
151  }
152  }
153 
154  return negative ? -totalValue : totalValue;
155 }
ERANGE
#define ERANGE
Definition: errno.h:54
endptr
double wchar_t **__restrict MLIBC_STUB_BODY long double wchar_t **__restrict endptr
Definition: string-stubs.cpp:234

References base, c, endptr, ERANGE, and errno.

8  for(size_t i = 0; i < size; i++) {
9  unsigned char a_byte = tolower(a[i]);
10  unsigned char b_byte = tolower(b[i]);
11  if(!a_byte && !b_byte)
12  return 0;
13  // If only one char is null, one of the following cases applies.

15  return -1;
16  if(a_byte > b_byte)

18  }

27  tmp++;

103  *(int *)buffer = 0;

107  "and SO_SNDBUF is unimplemented\e[39m"

114  "unimplemented, hardcoding SOCK_STREAM\e[39m"
115  << frg::endlog;

117  return 0;

124  return 0;
125  } else if (layer == SOL_SOCKET && number == SO_KEEPALIVE) {
126  mlibc::infoLogger()

128  "SO_KEEPALIVE is unimplemented, hardcoding 0\e[39m"
129  << frg::endlog;
130  *(int *)buffer = 0;
131  return 0;
132  } else {
133  mlibc::panicLogger()
134  << "\e[31mmlibc: Unexpected getsockopt() call, layer: " << layer

398  {
399  int fd = epoll_create1(0);
400  if (fd == -1)
401  return -1;
402 
403  for (int k = 0; k < FD_SETSIZE; k++) {
404  struct epoll_event ev;
405  memset(&ev, 0, sizeof(struct epoll_event));
406 
407  if (read_set && FD_ISSET(k, read_set))
408  ev.events |= EPOLLIN;
409  if (write_set && FD_ISSET(k, write_set))
410  ev.events |= EPOLLOUT;
411  if (except_set && FD_ISSET(k, except_set))
412  ev.events |= EPOLLPRI;
413 
414  if (!ev.events)
415  continue;
416 
417  ev.data.u32 = k;
418  if (epoll_ctl(fd, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, k, &ev))
419  return -1;
420  }
421 
422  struct epoll_event evnts[16];

424  fd, evnts, 16,
425  timeout ? (timeout->tv_sec * 1000 + timeout->tv_nsec / 100) : -1,
426  sigmask);
427 
428  if (n == -1)
429  return -1;
430

432  fd_set res_write_set;
433  fd_set res_except_set;
434  FD_ZERO(&res_read_set);
435  FD_ZERO(&res_write_set);
436  FD_ZERO(&res_except_set);
437 
438  int m = 0;
439 
440  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
441  int k = evnts[i].data.u32;
442 
443  if (read_set && FD_ISSET(k, read_set) &&
444  evnts[i].events & (EPOLLIN | EPOLLERR | EPOLLHUP)) {
445  FD_SET(k, &res_read_set);
446  m++;
447  }
448 
449  if (write_set && FD_ISSET(k, write_set) &&
450  evnts[i].events & (EPOLLOUT | EPOLLERR | EPOLLHUP)) {
451  FD_SET(k, &res_write_set);
452  m++;
453  }
454 
455  if (except_set && FD_ISSET(k, except_set) &&
456  evnts[i].events & EPOLLPRI) {
457  FD_SET(k, &res_except_set);
458  m++;
459  }
460  }
461 
462  if (close(fd))
463  __ensure("mlibc::pselect: close() failed on epoll file");
464 
465  if (read_set)
466  memcpy(read_set, &res_read_set, sizeof(fd_set));
467 
468  if (write_set)
469  memcpy(write_set, &res_write_set, sizeof(fd_set));
470 
471  if (except_set)
472  memcpy(except_set, &res_except_set, sizeof(fd_set));

218  *bytes_read = 0;
219  return -result;

224  *bytes_read = 0;
